pullRequest.body:
Prove regularity of `RieszContent`, define the Riesz measure `Î¼ Î›` and prove basic properties.

Motivation: these definitions and lemmas will be used to prove the Riesz-Markov-Kakutani theorem, characterizing `Î¼ Î›`.

In this PR, it is assumed to be NNReal-linear. In this way, the proof of the RMK theorem will be twice as long as a proof for `Real`-linear `Î›` because one cannot define `-f`. #12290 proves the RMK theorem for real linear `Î›`, using the Riesz measure defined in this PR through `toNNRealLinear`.

---
- [x] depends on: #21206 for `partialOrder`

Most probably the naming `Î›_mono` is not good, but I don't know which is the right one.

nodes.body: messageFile.md
Great to see this moving forward! Could you please address the comments I made on #12290 ? Thanks!
Thanks for your reviews! sure, I will do it.
thanks for massive golfing!

Can you clarify the status of the PR? It's marked as RFC (request for comments), but to me it looks like a normal PR, that could be merged quickly if you deal with the last comments by @YaelDillies, so I'm a little bit confused.
messageFile.md
messageFile.md

Sorry for my late replies and commits. I put RFC because I can only first prove the `Real`-linear version of the RMK theorem #12290 although here `Î›` is `NNReal`-linear. One has to go back and forth between `Real` and `NNReal` to prove finally the `NNReal`-version of the RMK theorem, and I wanted to ask whether it's ok.

I made small PR's as requested and updated the docstring.

This PR/issue depends on:
* ~~leanprover-community/mathlib4#21206~~
By **[Dependent Issues](https://github.com/z0al/dependent-issues)** (ðŸ¤–). Happy coding!

```suggestion
    (h : tsupport f âŠ† K) : .ofNNReal (Î› f) â‰¤ rieszMeasure Î› K := by
```

What about
```suggestion
lemma CompactlySupportedContinuousMap.monotone_of_nnreal : Monotone Î› := by
```
`LE` is not defined for `C_c(X, NNReal)`. for the moment I revert this.
Can you leave a comment about why you can't spell that lemma with `Monotone`?
done
actually, it was not difficult to use `Monotone`. done

```suggestion
lemma rieszContent_ne_top {K : Compacts X} : rieszContent Î› K â‰  âŠ¤ := by
```

```suggestion
  simp only [rieszContent, le_antisymm_iff, le_iInf_iff, ENNReal.coe_le_coe]
  constructor
```
will let you golf things below

```suggestion
      have : Î› f * Î± = Î› (Î±.toNNReal â€¢ f) := by
```
Why is this about `V : Opens X` rather than `V : Set X` + `IsOpen V`?
I did so because in #12290 I defined `V` which takes value in `Opens`. Should I change?
Yeah, more syntactically general lemmas are better, unless you think this lemma will only ever be used for `V : Opens X`, but I don't really see why that would be the case myself
I see. done and changed the names of the lemmas

```suggestion
      set K' := f â»Â¹' Ici Î±â»Â¹.toNNReal with hK'
```
Same thing here for `K`

```suggestion
lemma CompactlySupportedContinuousMap.monotone_of_nnreal {fâ‚ fâ‚‚ : C_c(X, â„â‰¥0)} (h : fâ‚.1 â‰¤ fâ‚‚.1) :
```
Any reason you're squeezing this simp? It's already terminal
no particular reason (here I have to first `rw`). Why should one not squeeze?
[This is explained in the style guide](https://leanprover-community.github.io/contribute/style#squeezing-simp-calls)
ah, I thought I had read through the style guide but I had missed it, sorry!
It was added recently!

Can you make the docstring not rely on context that the reader can only access by scrolling through the file?

Currently if I hover over `rieszMeasure` and see
```
`rieszContent` is promoted to a measure.
```
I still don't know what `rieszMeasure` is
I explained what `rieszContent` is, is this what you mean?

From
```
/-- `rieszContent` gives a `Content` from `Î› : C_c(X, â„â‰¥0) â†’â‚—[â„â‰¥0] â„â‰¥0`. Here `rieszContent Î›` is
promoted to a measure. -/
```
I still have no idea what `rieszMeasure` is or does. Eg what values does it take? what important property does it have?

I tried adding a description (which is [MeasureTheory.Content.measure_apply](https://leanprover-community.github.io/mathlib4_docs/Mathlib/MeasureTheory/Measure/Content.html#MeasureTheory.Content.measure_apply)), is this what you mean?
I would like to be able to understand the definition without having to read any other docstring. Currently, you still require me to read up what `Content.outerMeasure` does
I don't know how to characterize `rieszMeasure` without using some other definitions. I wrote the RMK theorem for characterization, is this fine?

```suggestion
lemma le_rieszMeasure_of_isCompact_tsupport_subset {f : C_c(X, â„â‰¥0)} (hf : âˆ€ x, f x â‰¤ 1)
```

```suggestion
lemma exist_add_eq {fâ‚ fâ‚‚ : C_c(Î±, â„â‰¥0)} (h : fâ‚.1 â‰¤ fâ‚‚.1)  : âˆƒ (g : C_c(Î±, â„â‰¥0)), fâ‚ + g = fâ‚‚ := by
```

Here is a golf
```suggestion
  refine âŸ¨fun K' hK' â†¦ rieszContentAux_mono Î› (hK'.trans interior_subset), ?_âŸ©
  rw [iInf_le_iff]
  intro b hb
  rw [rieszContentAux, ENNReal.le_coe_iff]
  have : b < âŠ¤ := by
    obtain âŸ¨F, hFâŸ© := exists_compact_superset K.2
    exact (le_iInf_iff.mp (hb âŸ¨F, hF.1âŸ©) hF.2).trans_lt ENNReal.coe_lt_top
  refine âŸ¨b.toNNReal, (ENNReal.coe_toNNReal this.ne).symm, NNReal.coe_le_coe.mp ?_âŸ©
  apply le_iff_forall_pos_le_add.mpr
  intro Îµ hÎµ
  lift Îµ to â„â‰¥0 using hÎµ.le
  obtain âŸ¨f, hfleoneonK, hfleâŸ© := exists_lt_rieszContentAux_add_pos Î› K (Real.toNNReal_pos.mpr hÎµ)
  rw [rieszContentAux, Real.toNNReal_of_nonneg hÎµ.le, â† NNReal.coe_lt_coe] at hfle
  refine ((le_iff_forall_one_lt_le_mulâ‚€ (zero_le (Î› f))).mpr fun Î± hÎ± â†¦ ?_).trans hfle.le
  rw [mul_comm, â† smul_eq_mul, â† map_smul]
  set K' := f â»Â¹' Ici Î±â»Â¹
  have hKK' : â†‘K âŠ† interior K' :=
    subset_interior_iff.2 âŸ¨f â»Â¹' Ioi Î±â»Â¹, isOpen_Ioi.preimage f.1.2,
      fun x hx â†¦ (inv_lt_one_of_one_ltâ‚€ hÎ±).trans_le (hfleoneonK x hx),
      preimage_mono Ioi_subset_Ici_selfâŸ©
  have hK'cp : IsCompact K' := .of_isClosed_subset f.2 (isClosed_Ici.preimage f.1.2) fun x hx â†¦
    subset_closure ((inv_pos_of_pos <| zero_lt_one.trans hÎ±).trans_le hx).ne'
  set hb' := hb âŸ¨K', hK'cpâŸ©
  simp only [Compacts.coe_mk, le_iInf_iff] at hb'
  exact (ENNReal.toNNReal_mono (by simp) <| hb' hKK').trans <| csInf_le'
    âŸ¨Î± â€¢ f, fun x â†¦ (inv_le_iff_one_le_mulâ‚€' (zero_lt_one.trans hÎ±)).mp, by simpâŸ©
```

```suggestion
  apply le_trans _ hg.2.le
```

```suggestion
lemma exist_add_eq {fâ‚ fâ‚‚ : C_c(Î±, â„â‰¥0)} (h : fâ‚.1 â‰¤ fâ‚‚.1) : âˆƒ (g : C_c(Î±, â„â‰¥0)), fâ‚ + g = fâ‚‚ := by
```

Here is a golf
```suggestion
  refine âŸ¨âŸ¨fâ‚‚.1 - fâ‚.1, ?_âŸ©, ?_âŸ©
  Â· apply (fâ‚.hasCompactSupport'.union fâ‚‚.hasCompactSupport').of_isClosed_subset isClosed_closure
    rw [tsupport, tsupport, â† closure_union]
    apply closure_mono
    intro x hx
    contrapose! hx
    simp only [ContinuousMap.toFun_eq_coe, coe_toContinuousMap, Set.mem_union, Function.mem_support,
      ne_eq, not_or, Decidable.not_not, ContinuousMap.coe_sub, Pi.sub_apply] at hx âŠ¢
    simp [hx.1, hx.2]
  Â· ext x
    simpa [â† NNReal.coe_add] using add_tsub_cancel_of_le (h x)
```

```suggestion
  PartialOrder.lift (fun f => \u=f) (fun f g _ => by aesop)
```
Also consider making this a new PR, for discoverability
I opened #21206. sorry, I don't understand this suggested commit (it fails).
Sorry, I was on my phone so couldn't input the unicode. You are supposed to type `\u=f`
I see. As this part has been split #21206 and you made changes there, I wait for it to be merged.

What about
```suggestion
/-- Given a `â„â‰¥0`-linear functional `Î›` on `C_c(X, â„â‰¥0)`. the Riesz measure is a measure which
respects `âˆ« x, f x âˆ‚(rieszMeasure Î›) = Î› f` for all `f : C_c(X, â„â‰¥0)`. -/
```
Well, I'm not sure... this will be proved in the later theorem, and this is not the definition of `rieszMeasure`.

Yeah but the definition is just below. This doesn't necessarily need to be repeated in the docstring.

If you do want to repeat it, you can do
```suggestion
/-- Given a `â„â‰¥0`-linear functional `Î›` on `C_c(X, â„â‰¥0)`. the Riesz measure is a measure which
respects `âˆ« x, f x âˆ‚(rieszMeasure Î›) = Î› f` for all `f : C_c(X, â„â‰¥0)`.

This is defined as the measure corresponding to the Riesz content of `Î›`. -/
```
My point is that docstrings will mostly be read *after the fact*. People will see them either when hovering over the definition in a later file or in the docs

```suggestion
    (h : tsupport f âŠ† V) : .ofNNReal (Î› f) â‰¤ rieszMeasure Î› V := by
```

```suggestion
  apply le_trans _ (measure_mono h)
```

```suggestion
protected lemma exists_add_of_le {fâ‚ fâ‚‚ : C_c(Î±, â„â‰¥0)} (h : fâ‚ â‰¤ fâ‚‚) : âˆƒ (g : C_c(Î±, â„â‰¥0)), fâ‚ + g = fâ‚‚ := by
```
to match `exists_add_of_le`
